ghostPage.title: About the Author

ghostPage.plaintext:
Tipid Dev was developed and is maintained by Lester Bolotaolo
[https://twitter.com/akoposilesb], a self-taught full-stack developer
specializing in web application development. He specializes in Laravel for
full-stack development, and Quasar and React for frontend development.

His first project was the Agriculture and Fisheries Modernization Plan (AFMP)
Information System which was used to gather and process data for the investment
plan of the agriculture and fisheries sector. The app was built using PHP and
connected to SurveyCTO through REST API for the data gathering.

He singlehandedly developed the Public Investment Programming System (PIPS) of
the Department of Agriculture (DA) which serves as the in-house Public
Investment Program (PIP) Online System developed by the National Economic and
Development Authority. It is used by the investment programming focal persons
from the various offices, bureaus, attached agencies and attached corporations
of the agency. The system was built using Laravel and AlpineJS and hosted in
Z.com cpanel hosting.

He also worked on PMS Tasker [https://pms-tasker.web.app], a web-based
productivity app designed to monitor progress of assignments by staff within the
office of the Procurement Division of the DA. Initially designed for personal
use, the app was shared with colleagues and eventually used by everyone. The app
was built using Quasar Framework and Firebase backend.

Lester also took a React course on Zero-to-Mastery Academy in Udemy. He is
currently working on an e-commerce site for a coffee-pastry business.

Prior to being a full-stack developer, Lester worked as a planning officer at
the DA for more than six years. He was involved in IT-based projects such as the
National Food Consumption Quantification Study (NFCQS) web application and the
updating of the Registry System for Basic Sectors in Agriculture (RSBSA) through
web-based app. He was also part of several technical working groups (e.g.
Mindanao Inclusive Agriculture Development Project or MIADP technical writing
group, Sagip Saka TWG, rice roadmap TWG, etc.).

He served as technical staff at the DA Office of the Secretary for five years
where his most notable works include the DA Annual Report 2015 and the technical
assistance to the Midterm Evaluation of the Food Staples Sufficiency Program.
His main tasks involved gathering and processing of data into reports, briefers
and presentations, among others.

On the side, Lester is an investor/trader in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE)
market.

Lester graduated Master in Development Economics at the University of the
Philippines Development in 2021. He graduated cum laude in Bachelor of Science
in Agricultural Economics in 2011 at the University of the Philippines Los
Baños.
ghostPage.html:
Tipid Dev was developed and is maintained by Lester Bolotaolo, a self-taught full-stack developer specializing in web application development. He specializes in Laravel for full-stack development, and Quasar and React for frontend development.

His first project was the Agriculture and Fisheries Modernization Plan (AFMP) Information System which was used to gather and process data for the investment plan of the agriculture and fisheries sector. The app was built using PHP and connected to SurveyCTO through REST API for the data gathering.

He singlehandedly developed the Public Investment Programming System (PIPS) of the Department of Agriculture (DA) which serves as the in-house Public Investment Program (PIP) Online System developed by the National Economic and Development Authority. It is used by the investment programming focal persons from the various offices, bureaus, attached agencies and attached corporations of the agency. The system was built using Laravel and AlpineJS and hosted in Z.com cpanel hosting.

He also worked on PMS Tasker, a web-based productivity app designed to monitor progress of assignments by staff within the office of the Procurement Division of the DA. Initially designed for personal use, the app was shared with colleagues and eventually used by everyone. The app was built using Quasar Framework and Firebase backend.

Lester also took a React course on Zero-to-Mastery Academy in Udemy. He is currently working on an e-commerce site for a coffee-pastry business.

Prior to being a full-stack developer, Lester worked as a planning officer at the DA for more than six years. He was involved in IT-based projects such as the National Food Consumption Quantification Study (NFCQS) web application and the updating of the Registry System for Basic Sectors in Agriculture (RSBSA) through web-based app. He was also part of several technical working groups (e.g. Mindanao Inclusive Agriculture Development Project or MIADP technical writing group, Sagip Saka TWG, rice roadmap TWG, etc.).

He served as technical staff at the DA Office of the Secretary for five years where his most notable works include the DA Annual Report 2015 and the technical assistance to the Midterm Evaluation of the Food Staples Sufficiency Program. His main tasks involved gathering and processing of data into reports, briefers and presentations, among others.

On the side, Lester is an investor/trader in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) market.

Lester graduated Master in Development Economics at the University of the Philippines Development in 2021. He graduated cum laude in Bachelor of Science in Agricultural Economics in 2011 at the University of the Philippines Los Baños.
